intro: Campanula haradjanii, commonly known as the Haradjanii bellflower, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
